content.description: Sit start with two left angling holds. Go for better hold higher up. #15 on Marty Guide. Also wasn't named. Let me know differently.
content.location: "Hillside Boulder" (just North of Sunshine Boulder). West Face. Center.

content.description: Start standing and up the corner arete.Â
content.location: "Hillside Boulder" (just North of Sunshine), North facing corner.

content.description: Sit start off the rocks in the northwest corner and go up using large holds. #14 on the Marty Guide. It wasn't named so I gave it something. Let me know if it was something else.
content.location: On the "Hillside Boulder" also unnamed boulder a few feet north of Sunshine Boulder. West Face, Far Left Corner

content.description: Start on left hand on good crimp and right hand on crimp. go up. Looks really difficult because of hard to find feet. Looks like you can utilize a heel hook. #16 on the Marty Guide. Wasn't named. Let me know if it's something different.
content.location: "Hillside Boulder", Just a few feet north of Sunshine Bolder. West Side, Far Right.

content.description: Just another slab problem. #18 on the Marty Guide. Wasn't named. Let me know if it was anything different.
content.location: "Hillside Boulder" (just north of Sunshine) East Face, Center.

content.description: Climb up the easy flake to the top. #17 on the Marty Guide. It wasn't named. Let me know if it was something different.
content.location: "hillside boulder"(just north of Sunshine) East face, left side.

content.description: The Hillside Boulder is one of three boulders found right next to each other just off 20th street. The grades range from V-easy to V6.
